flawed_nl_solution:
Nurse Missy has 12*(1/3)=<<12*(1/3)=36/1>>36/1 special needs patients.
She has 12-36/1=<<12-36/1=-24>>-24 standard care patients.
Special needs patients take 20% longer to serve, which means serving takes 1.2*5=6 minutes per patient.
To serve dinner to all of her standard care patients, it will take 5*-24=<<5*-24=-120>>-120 minutes.
To serve dinner to all of her special needs patients, it will take 6*36/1=<<6*36/1=216>>216 minutes.
In total, it will take -120+216=<<-120+216=96>>96 minutes to serve dinner to all of her patients.
#### 96

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4, not 36/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
